Description.0: A reference number which is generated automatically recording each published sale. The number is unique and will change each time a sale is recorded.
Description.1: Sale price stated on the transfer deed.
Description.2: Date when the sale was completed, as stated on the transfer deed.
Description.3: This is the postcode used at the time of the original transaction. Note that postcodes can be reallocated and these changes are not reflected in the Price Paid Dataset.
Description.4: D = Detached, S = Semi-Detached, T = Terraced, F = Flats/Maisonettes, O = Other Note that: - we only record the above categories to describe property type, we do not separately identify bungalows - end-of-terrace properties are included in the Terraced category above - âOtherâ is only valid where the transaction relates to a property type that is not covered by existing values, for example where a property comprises more than one large parcel of land
Description.5: Indicates the age of the property and applies to all price paid transactions, residential and non-residential. Y = a newly built property, N = an established residential building
Description.6: Relates to the tenure: F = Freehold, L= Leasehold etc. Note that HM Land Registry does not record leases of 7 years or less in the Price Paid Dataset.
Description.7: Primary Addressable Object Name. Typically the house number or name.
Description.8: Secondary Addressable Object Name. Where a property has been divided into separate units (for example, flats), the PAON (above) will identify the building and a SAON will be specified that identifies the separate unit/flat.
Description.14: Indicates the type of Price Paid transaction. A = Standard Price Paid entry, includes single residential property sold for value. B = Additional Price Paid entry including transfers under a power of sale/repossessions, buy-to-lets (where they can be identified by a Mortgage), transfers to non-private individuals and sales where the property type is classed as âOtherâ. Note that category B does not separately identify the transaction types stated. HM Land Registry has been collecting information on Category A transactions from January 1995. Category B transactions were identified from October 2013.
Description.15: Indicates additions, changes and deletions to the records.(see guide below). A = Addition C = Change D = Delete Note that where a transaction changes category type due to misallocation (as above) it will be deleted from the original category type and added to the correct category with a new transaction unique identifier.
